snippet: With better chairs and more mobile athletes, the pace of wheelchair tennis is getting quicker, and players are using harder shots with more spin.
abstract: Pace of wheelchair tennis has become faster and more aggressive, mirroring shifts in the traditional sport; changes have been brought about by technological improvements in chairs, which are now lighter and quicker, along with a generation of more mobile athletes; growing sport first came to United States Open in 2005, and there are now 170 tournament on six continents.
lead_paragraph: With better chairs and more mobile athletes, the pace of wheelchair tennis is getting quicker, and players are using harder shots with more spin.

headline.seo: At U.S. Open, Faster-Paced Wheelchair Tennis Is on Display
headline.main: On Wheels, Too, the Game Shifts Toward Speed
headline.print_headline: On Wheels, Too, the Game Shifts Toward Speed
